titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia architectural blueprints and drawings 1907-2004
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia architectural blueprints and drawings

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the buildings occupied by the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Items include architectural drawings and blueprints of exteriors and interior spaces and plans of the Sinkler Memorial Garden. Included are bound volumes of blueprints from 1908-1909, when the building on 22nd Street was constructed and from renovations made in 1955-1956. There are also a number of rolled, flat, and folded plans ranging in date from 1908 to 1994, with the bulk being from the 1970s and 1980s. These include drawings by Wallace Roberts & Todd for a proposed renovation in 1993-1994. Sinkler Memorial Garden plans include a copies of the Olmstead Bros. plan for the layout of the garden and drawings of proposed improvements from 1990. The collection also includes a small card file on non-commercial herbal gardens in the United States and Canada and a map of the 8th Ward of Philadelphia showing the old location of the College of Physicians at 13th and Locust.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
